conclusion: Initial speed of car A is 25 m/s
Initial speed of car B is 15 m/s
Car A’s speed decreases linearly to 0 in 25 s
Car B’s speed decreases linearly to 0 in 30 s
Acceleration of car A is -1.0 m/s²
Acceleration of car B is -0.50 m/s²
Position functions for cars A and B are established
Equation 10 t − ¼t² = d₀ is derived
Graph caption states cars avoid collision if reaction is as graphed
Equality 10 t − ¼t² = d₀ is satisfied at t = 20 s
For actual collision, equality must be reached slightly before 20 s
The two cars collide a little before the 20-s mark
The collision takes place before 20 s of braking
